class.name: jsx3.app.Model
class.text: The abstract base class that defines the JSX DOM. Instances of this class exist as nodes in a tree, each with a single parent and multiple children. This class includes all the methods for querying and manipulating the DOM's tree structure, such as getChild(), adoptChild(), getParent(), etc.

param.name: strName
param.text: a unique name distinguishing this object from all other JSX GUI objects in the JSX application

field.name: ASYNC_LOAD_TIMEOUT
field.text: The number of milliseconds before asynchronous component loads time out.

field.name: CIF_VERSION
field.text: Minimum supported version CIF formatted serialization files

field.name: CURRENT_VERSION
field.text: Minimum supported version for serialization files

field.name: LT_NORMAL
field.text: The normal load type for a DOM branch. The DOM branch deserializes and paints with its parent.

field.name: LT_SHOW_DESER
field.text: Load type indicating that the DOM branch will deserialize and paint as needed when it becomes visible. It is left to subclasses of Model to implement this functionality.

field.name: LT_SHOW_PAINT
field.text: Load type indicating that the DOM branch will paint as needed when it becomes visible. It is left to subclasses of Model to implement this functionality.

field.name: LT_SLEEP_DESER
field.text: Load type indicating that the DOM branch will deserialize and paint after its parent deserializes and the call stack resets.

field.name: LT_SLEEP_PAINT
field.text: Load type indicating that the DOM branch will paint after its parent paints and the call stack resets.

field.name: LT_SLEEP_PD
field.text: Load type indicating that the DOM branch will deserialize after its parent deserializes and the call stack resets and will paint after its parent paints and the call stack resets.

field.name: META_FIELDS
field.text: The allowed meta data fields. See getMetaValue() and setMetaValue().

field.name: PERSISTEMBED
field.text: Normal persistance value for a child that will be persisted.

field.name: PERSISTNONE
field.text: Persistance value fora child that is temporarily part of the DOM tree and will not be persisted.

field.name: PERSISTREF
field.text: Persistance value for a child that exists in an external serialization file and is referenced by URI.

field.name: PERSISTREFASYNC
field.text: Persistance value for a child that exists in an external serialization file and is referenced by URI. The loading of a child with this persistence value will happen asynchronously after the file that references it is loaded.

method.name: adoptChild

param.name: objChild
param.text: the child to adopt

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true or null, the object being adopted will be added to the parent's view via the parent's paintChild() method. This parameter is made available for those situations where a loop is executing and multiple objects are being adopted. As view operations are the most CPU intensive, passing false while looping through a collection of child objects to adopt will improve performance. After the last child is adopted, simply call repaint() on the parent to immediately synchronize the view.

param.name: bForce
param.text: if true, the adoption is forced, even if the parent/child don't accept such adoptions (onSetChild() and onSetParent() will still be called)

method.text: Appends a DOM node to this object after removing the node from its former parent reference. If the node to append does not already have a DOM parent, setChild() should be used instead of this method.

method.name: assembleFromXML

param.name: objElm
param.text: the serialized representation of this object.

return.text: true to deserialize any child objects or false to ignore them (for example if this method performs a custom child deserialization).

method.text:
Builds this object from its serialized XML representation. Subclasses of Model may override this method along with toXMLElm() to control their own serialized form.
When this method is called this object has already been instantiated but none of its properties have been set. This method sets all of its properties. Any children of this object are automatically deserialized after this method returns.

method.name: doClone

param.name: intPersist
param.text: the persistance value of the clone.

param.name: intMode
param.text: 0 for insert as the last child of the parent of this object and paint, 1 for insert as the last child of this parent of this object and do not paint, or 2 for load as a fragment.

return.text: the clone.

throws.text: if this object has no parent DOM node.

method.text: Creates and returns an exact replica of the object. The clone will be appended as a new child node of this object's parent node.

method.name: findAncestor

param.name: fctTest
param.text: test function, takes a single jsx3.app.Model parameter and returns true if the node matches.

param.name: bIncludeSelf
param.text: if true, include this object in the search

method.text: Returns the first ancestor passing the given test function.

method.name: findDescendants

param.name: fctTest
param.text: test function, takes a single jsx3.app.Model parameter and returns true if the node matches.

param.name: bDepthFirst
param.text: specifies whether to do a depth first or breadth first search.

param.name: bMultiple
param.text: if true, return an array of matches, otherwise just the first match.

param.name: bShallow
param.text: if true, only search direct children.

param.name: bIncludeSelf
param.text: if true, include this node in the search.

return.text: the match (bMultiple = false) or matches (bMultiple = true).

method.text: Finds all DOM nodes descending from this DOM node that pass the given test function. Results are guaranteed to be returned in order according to the search order used.

method.name: getAncestorOfName

param.name: strName
param.text: the name to query on.

return.text: the first ancestor with the given name or null if none found.

method.text: Returns the first ancestor with the given name.

method.name: getAncestorOfType

param.name: strType
param.text: the fully-qualified class name, class constructor function, or jsx3.Class instance.

return.text: the first ancestor of the given type or null if none found.

method.text: Returns the first ancestor of the given type.

method.name: getChild

param.name: vntIndexOrName
param.text: either the integer index or the string name of the child.

return.text: the child at the given index or with the given name, or null if no such child exists.

method.text: Returns the child DOM node of this node at the given index or with the given name. If a name is supplied, the children are searched in order and the first matching child is returned.

method.name: getChildIndex

return.text: the index or -1 if this object does not have a parent.

method.text: Returns the zero-based index for this DOM node in relation to its siblings.

method.name: getChildren
method.text: Returns an array containing all the child DOM nodes of this object. The return value is the original array rather than a copy and should not be modified.

method.name: getDescendantOfName

param.name: strName
param.text: the name to query on.

param.name: bDepthFirst
param.text: specifies whether to do a depth first or breadth first search.

param.name: bChildOnly
param.text: if true, only search the children of this DOM node.

return.text: the descendant with the given name or null if none found.

method.text: Finds the first descendant of this DOM node with a the given name.

method.name: getDescendantsOfType

param.name: strType
param.text: the fully-qualified class name, class constructor function, or jsx3.Class instance.

param.name: bShallow
param.text: if true, only search direct children, not all descendants.

return.text: an array of matching descendants

method.text: Finds all descendants of the given type.

method.name: getDynamicProperty

param.name: strName
param.text: property on this GUI object that will now use a dynamic property (e.g., 'jsxleft','jsxtop','jsxheight',etc.);

return.text: value of the property

method.text: Returns the value of the dynamic property @strPropName; if not found, returns null

method.name: getFirstChild
method.text: Returns the first child.

method.name: getFirstChildOfType

param.name: strType
param.text: the fully-qualified class name, class constructor function, or jsx3.Class instance.

param.name: bExact
param.text: if true then only return objects whose class is exactly strType (rather than returning subclasses too).

return.text: the child of the given type or null if none found.

method.text: Finds the first child of the given type.

method.name: getHelpId
method.text: Returns the help ID of this object.

method.name: getId

return.text: JSX id

method.text: Returns the custom JSX-generated id for the object (i.e., _jsx2384098324509823049).

method.name: getLastChild
method.text: Returns the last child.

method.name: getLoadType

return.text: LT_NORMAL, LT_SLEEP_PAINT, LT_SLEEP_DESER, LT_SLEEP_PD, LT_SHOW_PAINT, or LT_SHOW_DESER.

method.text: Returns the load type of this DOM node and the descending branch. The load type determines how this DOM branch deserializes and paints in relation to its parent DOM node.

method.name: getMetaValue

param.name: strKey
param.text: the name of the meta data field, one of the keys in META_FIELDS.

return.text: the meta data value or empty string.

method.text: Returns one of the meta data values stored at the top of the serialization file that this object was loaded from.

method.name: getNS

return.text: the namespace of the server that owns this object instance.

method.text: Returns the namespace that distinguishes this object's server (owner) from other server instances. The namespace is set when this object is bound to a DOM tree.

method.name: getName
method.text: Returns the custom developer-defined name of this object.

method.name: getNextSibling
method.text: Returns the next sibling.

method.name: getParent
method.text: Returns the parent DOM node of this object.

method.name: getPersistence

return.text: one of PERSISTNONE, PERSISTEMBED, PERSISTREF, PERSISTREFASYNC.

method.text: Returns the persistence bit for this model object.

method.name: getPreviousSibling
method.text: Returns the previous sibling.

method.name: getServer
method.text: Returns an object reference to the server that owns this object. This method returns null if this object is part of a DOM fragment. Until an object is added to a DOM tree by passing it as the parameter to setChild(), the object will be a DOM fragment.

method.name: getUriResolver
method.text: Returns the URI resolver for this DOM node. This method returns the server of this object unless this node or its ancestor was loaded into the DOM with an explicit URI resolver.

method.name: insertBefore

param.name: objMoveChild
param.text: the one being moved. Can belong to this object, another object, or can be a GUI fragment

param.name: objPrecedeChild
param.text: the one to insert before

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if false the repaint will be suppressed (useful for multiple obejct updates that would lead to unnecessary updates to the VIEW)

return.text: true if successful

method.text: Assigns objMoveChild as the previousSibling of objPrecedeChild

method.name: load

param.name: strURL
param.text: URL (either relative or absolute) of the serialization file to deserialize. This URL is resolved relative to objResolver, if provided, or the URI resolver of this DOM node.

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true or null the deserialized objects will be added to the parent's view via the parent object's paintChild() method.

param.name: objResolver
param.text: If this parameter is provided, strURL is resolved relative to it. Additionally, this resolver is stored as the URI resolver for this DOM node and its descendants.

return.text: the deserialized object. A serialization file may specify more than one root object, in which case this method returns the first deserialized object.

throws.text: if strURL is not the URL of a valid XML document.

method.text: Deserializes a JSX serialization file and appends the deserialized objects as children of this DOM node.

method.name: loadAndCache

param.name: strURL
param.text: URL (either relative or absolute) of the serialization file to deserialize. This URL is resolved relative to objResolver, if provided, or the URI resolver of this DOM node.

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true or null the deserialized objects will be added to the parent's view via the parent object's paintChild() method.

param.name: objCache
param.text: the cache to store the component XML documents in. If not provided, the cache of the server of this model object is used.

param.name: objResolver
param.text: If this parameter is provided, strURL is resolved relative to it. Additionally, this resolver is stored as the URI resolver for this DOM node and its descendants.

return.text: the deserialized object. A serialization file may specify more than one root object, in which case this method returns the first deserialized object.

throws.text: if strURL is not the URL of a valid XML document.

method.text: Loads a component file and caches the document in an XML cache. If the component file already exists in the cache then it is loaded from the cache. All component files loaded as a result of this call (referenced files) are also cached. This method is a useful replacement for load() when the same URL will be loaded multiple times in one application.

method.name: loadXML

param.name: strXML
param.text: the XML content of a JSX serialization file.

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true or null the deserialized objects will be added to the parent's view via the parent object's paintChild() method.

return.text: the deserialized object. A serialization file may specify more than one root object, in which case this method returns the first deserialized object.

throws.text: if strXML is not a valid XML document.

method.text: Deserializes a JSX serialization file and appends the deserialized objects as children of this DOM node.

method.name: onAfterAssemble

param.name: objParent
param.text: the parent of this object once it is attached to the DOM.

param.name: objServer
param.text: the server that this DOM object will attach to.

method.text: Called during deserialization of this object. This method provides a hook for initializing an object during deserialization since init() is not called. Called after this object has been instantiated and after its fields and children have been assembled.This method is called before this object is attached to the DOM, therefore getParent(), getServer(), getXML(), etc. return null.

method.name: onAfterAttach
method.text:
Called during deserialization of this object. This method provides a hook for initializing an object during deserialization since init() is not called. Called after this object has been instantiated and after it has been attached to the DOM. Methods overriding this method should usually begin with a call to jsxsuper().
When a new branch is attached to the DOM, this method is executed on each node in the branch. The order is reverse-breadth-first meaning that child nodes are notified from oldest to youngest and before the parent node.
This implementation of this method executes the on-after-deserialize script of this object.

method.name: onBeforeAssemble

param.name: objParent
param.text: the parent of this object once it is attached to the DOM.

param.name: objServer
param.text: the server that this DOM object will attach to.

method.text: Called during deserialization of this object. This method provides a hook for initializing an object during deserialization since init() is not called. Called after this object has been instantiated but before its fields and children have been assembled. This method is called before this object is attached to the DOM, therefore getParent(), getServer(), getXML(), etc. return null.

method.name: onChangeServer
method.text: Called when the server owning this DOM node changes.

method.name: onChildAdded

param.name: objChild
param.text: the added child.

method.text: Hook that notifies the model object that a child has been added to it.

method.name: onDestroy

param.name: objParent
param.text: reference to the former parent

method.text:
The finalizer method. This method provides a hook for subclasses of this class to perform custom logic when an instance of this class is removed from the DOM. Methods that override this method should begin with a call to jsxsuper().
Note that this method is called after this object has been removed from the DOM tree. Therefore this.getParent() and this.getServer() will return null. Use the objParent parameter for access to the DOM tree.

method.name: onRemoveChild

param.name: objChild
param.text: the child that was removed

param.name: intIndex
param.text: the index of the removed child

method.text:
Hook that notifies this model object that one of its children has been removed. This hook exists simply to allow this object to perform cleanup/re-render, and does not provide a veto mechanism. This method is called after the child has been removed from the model (this.getChildren() does not contain objChild) and after the child has been removed from the view (objChild.getRendered() is also null).
This method is only called if the child is being removed from the DOM but this object (the parent) is not being removed. Therefore, this hook cannot be relied upon for garbage collection.
If removeChildren() is called on this object, this hook is called exactly once after all children have been removed. In that case, the first parameter to this method will be the array of children and the second parameter will be null.
In general a method overriding this method should begin by calling jsxsuper.

method.name: onSetChild

return.text: true to allow the set, false to veto

method.text: Hook that allows for a prospective parent DOM node to veto the adoption of a child.

method.name: onSetParent

return.text: true to allow the set, false to veto

method.text: Hook that allows for a prospective child DOM node to veto its adoption by a parent. This method is only called if the prospective parent has not already vetoed the adoption in the onSetChild() method.

method.name: removeChild

param.name: vntItem
param.text: either the index of the child to remove or the child itself.

return.text: this object

method.text: Removes a DOM child from this object. This method removes the on-screen DHTML of the removed object. The removed child will be completely derefenced from the DOM and will be prepped for garbage collection. If a DOM child must continue to exist after removing it from this parent, adoptChild() should be used instead of this method.

method.name: removeChildren

param.name: arrChildren
param.text: the children to remove. If this parameter is not provided then all children are removed.

return.text: this object.

method.text: Removes some or all children of this object.

method.name: selectDescendants

param.name: strExpr
param.text: the selection query

param.name: bSingle
param.text: if true, return only the first match.

throws.text: if strExpr is an invalid selection query.

method.text:
Select objects from the DOM using a CSS3-like selection syntax. This method considers the DOM tree whose root is this object. The following constructs are supported:
jsx3_gui_ClassName - matches objects by their exact class. Replace "." with "_" in the selector.
* - matches any object
#id - matches objects whose name equals id
.class-name - matches objects for which getClassName() is defined and returns a string that contains the token class-name
:first and :last - matches objects that are their parents' first and last children
:nth(n) and nth-child(n) - matches objects whose child index is equal to n
:instanceof(ClassName) - matches objects that are instances of the class or interface ClassName
[prop="value"] and [prop*="value"] - matches objects whose value for field prop equals value or, with "*", contains value. The quotes around value are optional.
[getter()="value"] and [getter()*="value"] - matches objects whose return value for method getter equals value or, with "*", contains value. The quotes around value are optional.
AB - matches objects that match both A and B
A B - matches descendants of objects matching A that match B
A > B - matches immediate children of objects matching A that match B

method.name: setChild

param.name: objChild
param.text: the root node of a DOM fragment.

param.name: intPersist
param.text: defines how the child will be persisted/serialized. The valid values are the four persistence values defined as static fields in this class.

param.name: strSourceURL
param.text: the path to the serialization file where the child exists. This parameter is only relevant if the given intPersist is PERSISTREF or PERSISTREFASYNC.

param.name: strNS
param.text: the namespace of the child to append. This parameter is normally not required but is useful when sharing DOM nodes between servers with different namespaces.

return.text: this object or false if the set was vetoed

throws.text: if this object is part of a DOM fragment (the namespace is null) and the strNS parameter is not specified.

method.text: Appends a child DOM node to this parent DOM node. If the child already has a parent, adoptChild() should be used instead to ensure that the child is removed from its current parent.

method.name: setDynamicProperty

param.name: strName
param.text: property on this GUI object that will now use a dynamic property (e.g., 'jsxleft','jsxtop','jsxheight',etc.);

param.name: strValue
param.text: name of a dynamic style, whose value will be used

param.name: bNoSave
param.text: When true, this dynamic property will not be serialized with the object.

return.text: this object

method.text: Assigns a dynamic property to one of this object's instance properties.

method.name: setHelpId
method.text: Sets the help ID of this object.

method.name: setLoadType

param.name: intLoadType
param.text: LT_NORMAL, LT_SLEEP_PAINT, LT_SLEEP_DESER, LT_SLEEP_PD, LT_SHOW_PAINT, or LT_SHOW_DESER.

method.text: Sets the load type of this DOM node and the descending branch.

method.name: setMetaValue

param.name: strKey
param.text: the name of the meta data field, one of the keys in META_FIELDS

param.name: strValue
param.text: the new value of the meta data field.

method.text: setS one of the meta data values stored at the top of a component's serialization file.

method.name: setName

param.name: strName
param.text: a name unique among all DOM nodes currently loaded in the application.

method.text: Sets the custom developer-defined name of this object.

method.name: setPersistence

param.name: intPersist
param.text: one of PERSISTNONE, PERSISTEMBED, PERSISTREF, PERSISTREFASYNC.

return.text: this object

method.text: Sets the persistence bit for this model object.

method.name: toString
method.text: Returns a string representation of this object.

method.name: toXML

param.name: objProperties
param.text: name-value pairs that affect the serialization. See toXMLDoc() for a description.

return.text: this object serialized as an XML string.

method.text: Returns this object serialized as XML by calling toString() on the result of toXMLDoc() called on this object.

method.name: toXMLDoc

param.name: objProperties
param.text: name-value pairs that affect the serialization. See above for valid names and how they affect serialization.

return.text: this object serialized as an XML document.

method.text:
Serializes this object as an XML document.
The objProperties parameter may include the following keys:
onafter {String} - the value of the onAfterDeserialize element
onbefore {String} - the value of the onBeforeDeserialize element
name {String} - the value of the name element
icon {String} - the value of the icon element
description {String} - the value of the description element
children {boolean} - if true the children of this object, rather than this object, are serialized
persistall {boolean} - if true all descendants with persistence PERSISTNONE are included in the serialization

method.name: toXMLElm

param.name: objProperties
param.text: the same object passed to toXMLDoc().

method.text: Serializes this object as an XML node in the XML document objXML. This method can be overridden by subclasses of Model that want to provide their own serialized form. However, this method should at least return the node <object type="pkg.Class"/> in order to be compatible with deserialization.

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Returns the release/build for the class (i.e., "3.0.00")
